title: Definition namespace for attributes describing the source component of an ETL integration.
description: This section details ETL source attributes like name, description, scheduling and watermark specifications.

name.title: The name of the Integration source. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name should be a commonly used singular noun and be unique within a solution.

description.title: A description of the Integration source.
description.description: A phrase describing the source component of the Integration. Think about describing the what/where of this data source.

databaseOptions.title: Definition namespace for a database integration source.
databaseOptions.description: This section specified attributes related to an integration source of type Database. Attributes include the database query as well as minimum expected records.

query.title: The query to execute.
query.description: The query that will be executed on the source database.

minimumExpectedRecords.title: The minimum expected record count.
minimumExpectedRecords.description: This integration will not run, as per scheduled, unless a minimum number of records in the source have changed.

dataConnectionName.title: The name of the data connection. Contains no spaces.
dataConnectionName.description: The name of the data connection for this integration source. This must refer to an existing data connection in infrastructure, dependencies, dataConnections. Data Connection is required when the source is not a Nox Entity

watermark.title: Definition namespace for watermark columns on the integration source data.
watermark.description: This section lists the column(s) on the source data used to indicate whether a record in the source data has changed.

dateColumns.title: Column(s) in datetime format used for watermark purpose.
dateColumns.description: List datetime columns to be compared to target data to indicate if data has changed.

sequentialKeyColumn.title: Sequential key column used for watermark purpose.
sequentialKeyColumn.description: Specify a sequential key columns to be compared to target data to indicate if data has changed.

route.title: The path component for the request URI.
route.description: The path component for the request URI, e.g. '/myPath' in http://localhost:8081/myPath?myParameter=123.

exchangeFormat.title: The Http exchange format.
exchangeFormat.description: The format of the Http response data payload, eg. Json, XML.

httpVerb.title: The Http request verb.
httpVerb.description: The relevant verb detailing the Http request type, i.e. GET, POST, etc.

responseAttributes.title: The attributes of the source response.
